loans.name: Aurora

texts.es:
Aurora es de la ciudad de Carapeguá, ella vivía con sus abuelos, pero ambos ya fallecieron, por lo que se quedó sola, tuvo muchos inconvenientes en la vida, pero no se dejó caer.
Es una persona muy luchadora y por sobre todo quiere salir adelante. Está estudiando la carrera de Derecho y Notariado,  ya que así podrá desarrollarse como persona y como profesional. Pide este crédito para poder invertirlo en las cuotas de su universidad, para que así pueda seguir luchando por mejorar y crecer.
texts.en:
Aurora is from the city of Carapeguá.  She used to live with her grandparents but they died so she was left alone.  She had a lot of problems in life but didn't let them stop her.

Aurora's a very determined person and above all she wants to get ahead.  She's studying law and notary services because she'll be able to grow as a person and a professional.

She's requesting this loan to pay her university fees so she can keep on striving to improve and grow.

loans.use: to pay her university fees

loans.name: Alberto

texts.es:
Alberto es una persona que está trabajando y estudiando al mismo tiempo, comenta que es algo muy sacrificado el estudiar y trabajar al mismo tiempo, pero lo hace, ya que es la única forma de poder crecer.
Está siguiendo la carrera de contabilidad, con lo que quiere poder tener su propio negocio y aplicar todo lo que aprendió por medio de su carrera.
Pide este crédito para poder invertirlo en el pago de la cuota de su universidad y estar así al día con sus obligaciones. Agradece por esta oportunidad que está recibiendo de poder crecer.
texts.en:
Alberto is someone who works and goes to school at the same time.  He says it's very demanding, but he does it because it's the only way he can grow.  He's studying accounting so he can have his own business and apply everything he learned in his program.

Alberto's requesting this loan to pay his university fees so he can be current with his obligations.

He's grateful for this opportunity to be able to grow.

loans.use: to pay his university fees

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is a 52-year-old married woman. She has five children with ages ranging from 15 years to 30 years. She describes herself as confident. She operates a farm where she keeps cows which produce milk to sell. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her business is located in a favorable place and her primary customers are small scale. She describes her biggest business challenges as pests and diseases. 

Alice will use this 10,000 Kenyan shilling loan to buy animal feeds and drugs for her cows. Her business goal is to serve large-scale customers within five years. She hopes that in the future she will have a prosperous business. This is her first loan with SMEP - Deposit Taking Microfinance Limited.

loans.use: buy animal feeds and drugs for her cows

loans.name: Marhamatkhon

texts.ru: Мархаматхон добродушная женщина. Ей 43 года. Она вдова и имеет 2 несовершеннолетних детей. Она более 23 года работает в средней школе учительницей. Мархаматхон опытный педагог. Она имеет свой педагогический подход. Мархаматхон хочет, чтобы ее дети тоже получили хорошее образование. Ее дети учатся в частной школе. Она должна оплатить за учебу своих детей. Однако у нее нет денег, так как у нее маленькая зарплата. Мархаматхон запрашивает займ а сумму 3000 сомони для оплаты учёбы детей. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Marhamatkhon is a kind-hearted 43 year old woman.  She is a widow and has two minor children.  Marhamatkhon is an experienced teacher, having taught in a middle school for more than 23 years.  She uses her own approach to teaching.

Marhamatkhon wants her children to have good educations, too.  Her children go to a private school and she must pay their tuition.  However, she doesn't have the money because she earns a small salary.  Marhamatkhon is requesting a loan of 3,000 somoni (TJS) for paying the tuition.  She is relying on your kindness.

loans.use: to pay her children's tuition

loans.name: Sabohat

texts.ru:
Сабохат 38-летняя замужняя женщина с тремя детьми, проживает со своей семьей в районе Бохтар. Она занимается выращиванием крупнорогатого скота. Сабохат в основном разводит коров молочной и мясной породы. Она занимается этой деятельностью более 20 лет и имеет большой опыт в животноводстве. Сабохат ухаживает за скотом сама, а куплю и продажу осуществляет ее муж. Они работают совместно. Ее муж также является певцом. Он поёт на свадьбах и получает дополнительный доход. 
Сабохат сейчас просит кредит для животноводства. Она хочет купить корову и увеличить поголовье скота в своем скотном дворе.
texts.en:
Sabohat is 38 years old, married, and has three children.  She and her family live in the Bohtar region.  She is in the business of raising cattle.  Sabohat primarily raises beef and dairy cows.  She has been in this business for more than 20 years and has a great deal of experience in animal husbandry.  Sabohat looks after her cattle herself, and her husband does the buying and selling of the cattle.  They run the business together.  Her husband is also a singer and sings at weddings to earn a supplemental income.

Sabohat is requesting a loan for her cattle business.  She wants to buy a cow to enlarge her herd.

loans.use: to enlarge her herd with the purchase of a cow

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene is a 35-year-old married woman. She has four children with ages ranging from 2 years to 17 years. She describes herself as confident. She operates a farm where she grows vegetables. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her business is located in a conducive environment with market availability and sufficient water. Her primary customers are small scale. She describes her biggest business challenge to be price fluctuations.

Irene will use this 10,000 Kenyan shilling loan to buy seeds and fertilizer for use on her farm. Her business goal is to be dealing with large-scale customers within five years. She hopes that she will be successful in the future. This is her first loan with SMEP - Deposit Taking Microfinance Limited. She will use the anticipated profit to start another business.

loans.use: buy seeds and fertilizer for use on her farm

loans.name: Zhanna

texts.en:
Zhanna is a farmer. She lives in the village of Qarakert in the Armavir region and has been involved in agriculture for many years. Zhanna lives with her two sons. Her husband is a migrant worker. With the help of her two sons, Zhanna owns a small farm. It includes three cows and three calves. Zhanna gets milk and uses it in cheese production. She also cultivates watermelon. The income that they gather from their agribusiness is highly important, as it helps them to cover basic costs. Now this hardworking woman asks for this loan to be able to increase her livestock with three more calves and enlarge her agribusiness.

Zhanna has taken out a loan from a local financial institution before but unfortunately wasn't able to pay it back. However, thanks to work during recent times, she has been able to run her agribusiness in a sustainable way ensuring that she will be able to cover the monthly payments. So, she has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The second-chance loan program provides loans to people who have a bad credit history and have no access to credit products. Zhanna and her family will be thankful to all the lenders for helping them to maintain their agribusiness.

loans.use: to pay for three calves

loans.name: Gulbarg

texts.ru: Гулбарг порядочная женщина. Ей 35 лет. Она вдова и не имеет детей. Гулбарг живет одна. Она более 2 лет работает в местной больнице. Она работает в отделе кадров. Гулбарг честно выполняет свою работу. Гулбарг является одной из успешных кадров. Она хочет расширить свой кругозор, получить второе высшее образование. С такой целью она поступила в университет. Она учится в очное отделение. Гулбарг успешно справляется и с учебой и с работой. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 4500 сомони для оплаты учебы в университете. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Gulbarg is a clean-living 35 year old woman.  She is a widow and has no children.  Gulbarg lives alone.  She has been working in the human resources department of the local hospital for more than two years.  She goes about her work honestly.  Gulbarg is one of the most successful of the staff members.

Gulbarg wants to broaden her horizons and earn a second degree.  With this goal in mind, she enrolled in the university where she takes a full course load.  Gulbarg is able to successfully handle both her course work and her work in the hospital.  She is requesting a loan of 4,500 somoni (TJS) to pay her university tuition.  She is relying on your kindness..

loans.use: to pay her university tuition

loans.name: Abdullojon

texts.ru:
Этот молодой мужчина фермер. Его зовут Абдуллочон. Он у себя дома в коровнике выращивает крупно рогатых скотов. В работе ему помогает его жена и брат. Абдуллочон женат и имеет детей. Его дети ходят в школу, и для их образования он старается всеми силами. 
   Абдуллочон просит кредит, чтобы купить крупно рогатых скотов. Он собирается кормить и выращивать их в коровнике. После определенных дней откорма Абдуллочон продаст их мясо на рынке родного района Вахш. Такой деятельностью он занимается около 4 года. Причина по которой Абдуллочон берет кредит это не предвиденные семейные расходы. Ему не хватает часть суммы для покупки скотов. Абдуллочон верит, что он сможет собрать часть недостающей суммы с Вашей помощью. Помогите ему!
texts.en:
This young man is named Abdullojon and he is a farmer.  He has a barn at home where he raises his cattle.  His wife and brother help him with his work.  Abdullojon is married and has children.  The children go to school and Abdullojon does every thing he can so they can get an education.  

Abdullojon is requesting the loan so he can buy cattle.  He plans to feed and raise them in his barn.  After fattening them up for a certain number of days, Abdullojon will sell their meat at the market in his native Vakhsh region.  Abdullojon has been in this business for 4 years.  He has to take out this loan because he had some unforeseen family expenses.  He doesn't have all the money he needs for this purchase.  Abdullojon believes that, with your help, he will be able to come up with the rest of the money.  Please help him!

loans.use: to buy cattle

loans.name: Violeta María

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Tosagua cada quince días se reúne el Grupo De Crédito La Inmaculada, este lugar se lo conoce por ser muy dinámico donde la mayoría de sus habitantes se dedican a la agricultura y a la cría de animales, por ser una zona con gran vegetación.
La señora Violeta tiene 52 años de edad, hace algún tiempo atrás su esposo falleció y de esa relación tiene  cuatro hijos mayores de edad, dos de ellos aun viven con ella y la menor estudia en universidad.
Doña Violeta para salir adelante y para que no les falte nada a su familia se dedica al comercio vende aliños, especias, sobrecamas, carteras y ropa entre otras cosas, tiene un pequeño local en el mercado local en el cual los fines de semana vende sus productos, ella también se desplaza a otras ciudades en los días de feria que hay en esos pueblos todas las semanas, los productos los compran en Santo Domingo, ella lleva más de 5  años con el negocio de los aliños, empezó con los créditos de la Fundación Espoir por lo cual esta agradecida ya que con esto ella y su familia salen adelante.
Este crédito es para comprar aliños, carteras, sabanas entre otras cosas. Es socia fundadora del Grupo De Crédito  desde hace ya 17 años y le gusta por la ayuda que le dan para salir adelante. Su sueño es que su hija sea una profesional.
texts.en:
The “La Inmaculada” credit group meets every two weeks in the city of Tosagua. This area is known for being very dynamic, where the majority of its residents are farmers and raise animals. It’s an area of great vegetation.

Violeta is 52 years old and her husband passed away some time ago. She has four adult children and two of them still live with her and the youngest attends university.  Violeta sells salad dressing, spices, bed spreads, wallets, clothing, and other things.  She has a small shop in the local market, where she sells her products on the weekends.  She also goes to other towns on days where there are fairs each week.  She makes her purchases in Santo Domingo.  She has had the salad dressing business for more than five years and she started with a loan through Fundación Espoir, for which she is grateful and through which her family gets ahead.

She will use the money from this loan to buy salad dressing, wallets, bed sheets, and other things.  She was a founding partner of the credit group 17 years ago and she likes that it helps her get ahead.  Her dream is for her daughter to become a professional.

loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Gina Jaqueline

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Tosagua cada quince días se reúne el Grupo De Crédito La Inmaculada, este lugar se lo conoce por ser muy dinámico donde la mayoría de sus habitantes se dedican a la agricultura y a la cría de animales, por ser una zona con gran vegetación.
En este lugar vive la señora Gina, tiene 46 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre pero no ha podido tener hijos. El marido es chofer.  
Doña Gina con la intención de ganar algo por su cuenta y para no depender de su marido se dedica al comercio, vende ropa de todo tipo, su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta y también vende en su casa, ella le envían la mercadería desde los Estados Unidos la cual es de muy buena calidad y del gusto de sus clientes. Son 3 años  que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien.
Este crédito es para pagar la ropa que está por llegarle. Lleva 6 ciclos  en el Grupo de Crédito y le gusta por la facilidad para conseguir los créditos. Su sueño es comprar un carro para salir a realizar sus ventas.
texts.en:
The “La Inmaculada” credit group meets every two weeks in the city of Tosagua. This area is known for being very dynamic, where the majority of its residents are farmers and raise animals. It’s an area of great vegetation.

Gina lives here.  She is 46 years old, in a common law marriage but doesn’t have any children.  Her husband is a driver.

Gina sells clothing of all types, door to door and from her home, in order to earn some money on her own and not have to be completely dependent on her husband.  She has her merchandise sent to her from the United States and it’s of good quality and to her customer’s liking.  She has had this business for three years and things are going very well for her.

She will use the money from this loan to pay for clothing that is on the way.  She has had six cycles in the credit group and she likes the ease of getting loans.  Her dream is to buy a car so she can make her sales.

loans.use: to buy clothing.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en: For the last 35 years, Josephine has been farming, which has been very profitable and earns a good income. She has applied for a second loan of 40,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) from VisionFund Kenya after repaying her first loan successfully. Josephine intends to use this loan to boost her farming activities by buying planting seeds, fertilizer and herbicides. Her monthly income right now is 17,000 KES and she hopes to use profits realized from her expanded business to pay back her loan to VisionFund Kenya and to improve her current business. In the future, she hopes to be a well-established farmer in her area.

loans.use: to buy planting seeds, fertilizer and herbicides

loans.name: Irma

texts.en: Irma is 46-year-old woman from village Jalaurta Sachkhere district. She lives with her husband, son and father-in-law, who gets monthly assistance from the local government. Her husband has a monthly income of 350 GEL from money transfers. The family is involved in agricultural activities. They have one milk-cow whose products are sold locally, and a plot of agricultural land belongs to the family. They cultivate the land and get a small income from its products. As Irma's husband doesn't have his own activity except transfers, he wants to do his bit for the welfare of the family and start his own activity. The start-up program, which is a joint initiative between Kiva and Credo, enables rural poor and inexperienced people to get a loan for starting or re-starting businesses. Irma's application was approved under the framework of this program to get a loan of 4,000 GEL to purchase working tools abroad, pay the toll for them, and open a vehicle repair workshop. Irma's husband will work as an artisan and generate income from private orders. The business initiative will be profitable because of its location and being the only workshop in the area. The family relies on the good will of the lenders and awaits your support.

loans.use: To purchase working tools and open a vehicle repair workshop

loans.name: Medilyn

texts.en: Medilyn is married with an only child. She manages her own cafeteria to make a living. She took out a new loan from Gata Daku Multi-purpose Cooperative (GDMPC) to buy more ingredients to cook in order to increase and improve her offerings. She wants to improve her business to have a better source of income for her family in the future.

loans.use: to buy more ingredients to cook in her cafeteria

loans.name: Carlsyne

texts.en:
Carlsyne is a 29 year old single woman. She has two children and describes herself as confident.

She has a clothes store and has been involved in this business for two years. She operates in a conducive environment and her primary customers are small scale.

Carlsyne says her biggest business challenge are price fluctuations, and she will use the KES 20,000 loan to add to her stock of clothes. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM. She will use the anticipated profits to buy a piece of land.

Carlsyne's business goal is to be successful within five years. She hopes that, in the future, she will have a prosperous business.

loans.use: to buy more clothes for resale

loans.name: Rafikzhon

texts.ru:
Этого продавца муки зовут Рафикжон. Он веселый и жизнелюбивый мужчина. Рафикжон старается работать и зарабатывать ради своей семьи и получает от этого удовольствие. Его профессия стала для него любимой работой. Для Рафикжона такая работа приносит хороший доход, и он может приятно проводить время. Рафикжон общительный мужчина. Он помогает продавцам определиться с выбором муки и масло, и выбрать продукт, который больше им подходит. 
   Рафикжон хочет взять кредит. На сумму кредита он планирует расширить свою деятельность и купить необходимое количество муки и бутылок хлопковых масел. Рафикжон надеется,  его маленький бизнес будет процветать после полученного кредита.
texts.en:
This man is named Rafikzhon and he sells flour.  He is a happy and life-loving man.  Rafikzhon tries to work and earn money for the sake of his family and this brings him satisfaction.  For him, the profession became a beloved job.  This kind of work brings Rafikzhon a good income and he enjoys spending his time this way.  Rafikzhon is an outgoing person.  He helps people with their choices of flour and oil, and with which products will best fit their needs.  

Rafikzhon wants to take out a loan.  He is planning to use the loan to expand his business by buying the necessary quantities of flour and bottles of cottonseed oil.  Rafikzhon hopes that his small business will flourish after receiving the loan.

loans.use: to buy flour and oils

loans.name: Rodita

texts.en:
Rodita is a hardworking entrepreneur who makes nipa roofing in the Philippines. Rodita has been in this business for four years. She earns additional income from farming vegetables and fruits.

She is borrowing PHP 22,000 through NWTF to buy more stocks of nipa leaves and bamboo to make nipa roofing.

Rodita has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She hopes to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of nipa leaves and bamboo to make nipa roofing.

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena is 39 years old and married with one child in school. Rowena works very hard to provide for her family.

Rowena runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been in this business for six years. 

Rowena requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks to sell like soap, canned goods, eggs, noodles, sugar, etc.

In the future Rowena would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks to sell like soap, canned goods, eggs, noodles, sugar, etc

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles is 28 years old and comes from Nakuru. He is married to Mercyline and they are blessed with two children aged seven years old and one month old.

Charles has been operating his small food kiosk for the last five years and to enable him buy stock like baking flour, sugar, charcoal and cooking fat to be used in his food stall, he has applied for his first loan of KES. 20,000 from VisionFund Kenya.

His monthly income right now is KES.10,000 and his intention is to use profits realized from his expanded business to educate his children and to pay back his loan to VisionFund Kenya and expand his current business.In the future, Charles hopes to be a successful businessman .

loans.use: to buy  sugar, cooking fat, baking flour and charcoal in bulk

loans.name: Mary Lou

texts.en: Mary Lou is a single entrepreneur who manages her retail business to make a living. She has been selling used clothes for more than a year and she earns well for her needs. She joined GDMPC and took out a loan to buy additional used clothes to resell. She wants to improve her business for a better living in the near future.

loans.use: to buy additional used clothes to resell

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en: Lolita owns and operates a nipa hut manufacturing business in their village and she has earned well enough from this so that she was able to repay her previous loans from GDMPC successfully. Currently, Lolita borrowed a new loan to purchase additional palm leaves and woven nipa mats to resell in order to cater for demand and fill orders. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase additional palm leaves and woven nipa mats to resell

loans.name: Trinh

texts.en:
Trinh, 34, lives in a small house in Ho Chi Minh City with her family, including one son and her husband. Her husband is a worker in a storehouse. 

Trinh earns money through her business selling food for breakfast. She would like to get a loan to buy food and new furniture for her food stall. She hopes her business will ensure that her family members, and especially her child, will have a better education and a better future.

loans.use: To buy food and furniture for her food stall.

loans.name: Badri

texts.en:
Badri is a 42-year-old married man. He lives with his wife, his student son and his pensioner mother in the Ozurgeti district. 

The family is involved in agricultural activities. They have a plot of agricultural land where maize and nut trees are grown. They always have high quality products, which are sold to local markets at a good price. 

Badri has a car workshop and he repairs cars. He needs additional equipment for his workshop and requests a loan. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo enables him to get a loan of 2,500 Gel for purchasing this equipment. When the equipment is purchased, he will get more orders from his customers and thus the income will increase. The Start Up program will be a great support for him.

loans.use: to purchase additional equipment for his workshop.

loans.name: Isaac's Group

texts.en:
Isaac is a member of this group in Chwele District.  He is pictured here in a group of 4 One Acre Fund group leader farmers.  The group leaders represent a total of 56 individual One Acre Fund farmers who are not pictured here.  Isaac has been selected to act as the Kiva group representative and is standing on the right with his hand raised.  He and the other farmers represented in this group are each receiving ¼ acre of maize and ¼ acre of sorghum or millet.  Each farmer is receiving an average input loan of 5,349 shillings for maize, millet and sorghum cultivation.
							
Isaac is 32 years old and has been a farmer for 10 years.  Isaac works as a farmer to provide for his two children.  The community and other farmers know Isaac as friendly, hardworking and trustworthy.  Other than farming, he is also involved in his community groups such as the men's group and prayer group. 

Isaac was not with One Acre Fund last year, and hopes he can have a better harvest this year with the support of One Acre Fund and the other farmers in the group.	

Isaac has just enrolled with One Acre Fund this year and is now preparing to be a One Acre Fund farmer during the 2014 Long Rains season.  Isaac joined One Acre Fund in order to get new farming methods.  He also volunteered to be a group leader and Kiva representative because he is an active community member.  Isaac plans to use the money that he earns from his next harvest to send his children to school and buy a cow.  He notes that working with One Acre Fund has led to many benefits for One Acre Fund farmers and that is why he has joined them.   

One Acre Fund focuses on working with smallholder farmers across Kenya.  The organization pre-purchases seeds and fertilizer when prices are low and passes the cost savings onto the farmers.  Isaac and his group will use the Kiva loan to cover this initial cost of purchasing the seeds and fertilizer package from One Acre Fund.  One Acre Fund continues providing training and support throughout the planting and harvesting season to ensure a good harvest and repayment.  With support from One Acre Fund and your loan, these farmers will have a chance at a successful harvest, increased profits and improved lives.

loans.use: To gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds for maize, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis is a 63-year-old married man. He has four children with ages ranging from 19 years to 26 years. He describes himself as confident. He operates a dairy farm where he keeps dairy cows which produce milk for sale. He has been involved in this business for three years. His business is located in a conducive environment, good for dairy farming, and his primary customers are small scale. He describes his biggest business challenges as pests and diseases.

Francis will use this 20,000 Kenyan shilling loan to buy stock of animal feeds. His business goal is to be successful within five years. He hopes that in the future he will be prosperous. This is his first loan with SMEP - Deposit Taking Microfinance Limited. He will use the anticipated profit to build a home for his family.

loans.use: to buy stock of animal feeds

loans.name: Grigol

texts.en:
Grigol is 44-year-old married man. He lives with his wife and pensioner mother in a small village of Zestaponi district. Grigol's wife works as a teacher at a local school and is paid 400 Gel per month. Grigol is involved in agricultural activities. He has a vineyard and a plot of land where walnut trees are grown. Grigol produces wine and sells it locally. 

Grigol decided to start a new business and requested a loan. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo, enables him to get a loan of $ 4500 for purchasing a minibus. When the minibus is purchased, he will begin to sell fruits and vegetables. The new business initiative will be a great support for the family, as Grigol will have his own stable income. He awaits your support.

loans.use: To purchase a minibus and sell fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is a 57-year-old married woman. She has 3 children. She describes herself to be enterprising. She operates a retail store where she sells sandals, cooking pans, thermoses and other items. She has been involved in this business for 15 years. Her business is located in a place with potential and her primary customers are regular customers. She describes her biggest business challenge to be price inflation. 

She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to add to her stock of sandals, cooking pans and other items. Her business goal is to open a wholesale shop within 5 years. She hopes that, in the future, she will better be able to provide for her family. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM. She will use the anticipated profits to cater to her family's needs.

loans.use: to add to her stock of sandals, cooking pans and other items.

loans.name: Muhammadzoir

texts.ru: Этого молодого человека зовут Мухаммадзоир. Он женат и является отцом двухлетней девочки. Мухаммадзоир со своей семьей проживает в городе Кургантюбе. Он после окончания школы не смог поступить в университет из-за финансов и начал зарабатывать на жизнь. Последние два года Мухаммадзоир занимается предоставлением услуги такси в своем городе. Ему нравится его работа, однако сейчас он не может продолжить работу, поскольку его машина имеет технические неполадки. У Мухаммадзоира на руках нет достаточной суммы, чтобы отремонтировать машину и поэтому он обратился за кредитом. На сумму от кредита он хочет купить запасные части машины и отремонтировав его продолжить свою работу. Мухаммадзоир просит поддержки, потому что кроме услуги такси у него нет другого источника дохода.
texts.en:
This young man is named Muhammadzoir.  He is married and the father of a two year old girl.  Muhammadzoir and his family live in the city of Qurgan-Tube.  After finishing school, he couldn't go to the university because of his finances, so he started to earn a living.

For the last two years, Muhammadzoir has been in business offering taxi services in his city.  He likes this job, but right now he isn't able to work because his car has mechanical problems.  Muhammadzoir is asking for a loan because he doesn't have enough money on hand to repair his car and get back to work.  Muhammadzoir is asking for help because he has no other source of income besides driving his taxi.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for repairing his car

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina is 52 years old and was blessed with four children. She is married to a farmer and they live happily in a rural community. She helps her husband in cultivating their farmland to earn a living. 

Due to the high cost of school fees, she and her husband aim to improve their farming business to increase their yields and income. Having inadequate capital, Regina is asking for a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy fertilizer and pesticides needed in rice production. Through this loan, they are hoping that they will have a high production this coming harvest season.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides needed in rice production.

loans.name: Evelinda

texts.en:
Evelinda owns and manages a small variety store within her community. She aims to make her business more profitable to help her husband in meeting their needs and financing the education of their youngest child.

To further improve the business, she is asking for a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy additional stocks of beverages, laundry soaps, snack foods, assorted candies, seasonings and soft drinks to sell. Through hard work and strong determination, she believes that she will continue to improve her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of beverages, laundry soaps, snack foods, assorted candies, seasonings and soft drinks to sell.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 50 years old, from Naivasha, and is married. She and her husband have three children who are in school.

Mary has a poultry business that she has been running for the past six years and has applied for her first loan from VisionFund Kenya to enable her to buy more chicks to add to her stock. She is optimistic that her business will do better after the loan.

She hopes to be the top farmer in her home area.

loans.use: to buy more chicks to add to her poultry stock.

loans.name: Ma. Theresa

texts.en:
Ma. Theresa previously accessed a 30,000 PHP loan that she utilized to buy feed and poultry needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children, and also in her personal, household and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another 35,000 PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy feed and poultry needed in her business. Her profits from this business will definitely help sustain their daily needs and the education of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Ma. Theresa dreams to be more successful in her business and hopes to have their house renovated. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her life and business every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God that she studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for feed and poultry needed in her business.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is a 46-year-old married woman. She has three children. She describes herself as industrious. 

She operates a beauty salon where she offers hairdressing services. She has been involved in this business for 11 years. Her business is located in a  place with good potential and her primary customers are ladies. She describes her biggest business challenge as the high cost of beauty salon materials. 

She will use the KES 20,000 loan to add stock of hair weaves and beauty products for use in the salon. She hopes that in the future, she will grow her business and improve her family life. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM. She will use the anticipated profit to cater to her family's needs.

loans.use: to add stock of hair weaves and beauty products.

loans.name: Patima

texts.en:
Patima, age 28, is from the Zugdidi district, west Georgia. She is living with her husband and three children (1, 4 and 8 years old).  The only one who makes money in the household is Patima’s husband, Zviad, who works as a security guard and gets a small monthly salary.

In order to generate additional income, Patima decided to start up a grocery store near her house and sell various food products.  The family needs money to buy construction materials and build a small store. They will buy stock of merchandise with their own savings.  Patima will work as a salesperson and serve her clients in a friendly way. The family will get more income and they will be able to cover household expenses as well as improve their living conditions in future.

loans.use: to buy construction materials and build a grocery store.

loans.name: Rotikien

texts.en:
Rotikien is 30 years old from Sakutiek and is married to Anne. They have three children who are between 5 years and 3 months old.

Rotikien has a farming business that he has been running for many years. He has applied for his first loan from Vision Fund Kenya to enable him to buy seedlings and pay for labour.

He hopes to own a farm in the Sakutiek area.

loans.use: To buy seedlings and pay for labour.

loans.name: Thelma

texts.en:
Thelma is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. Thelma has been in this business for five years. She earns additional income from farming vegetables.

She is borrowing PHP 23,000 through NWTF to buy items to sell like soap, sugar, milk, eggs, spices, chips, etc. for her general store business.

Thelma has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She hopes to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like soap, sugar, milk, eggs, spices, chips, etc.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is a 29-year-old married woman. She has two children. She describes herself as industrious. 

She operates a tailoring shop where she makes clothes to sell. She has been involved in this business for two years. Her business is located in a place with good potential and her primary customers are regular customers. She describes her biggest business challenge as the high cost of tailoring  materials. 

She will use the KES 20,000 loan to add stock of fabric and threads for making clothes. Her business goal is to own a clothes brand within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will sustain her family through business. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to add stock of fabric and threads for making clothes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more items like sugar and rice for her general store.

loans.name: Simon

texts.en:
Simon is 50 years old and is from Sakutiek in Naivasha, Kenya. He is married to Alice. They have eight children who are all in school.

Simon has a farming business that he has been running for many years. He has applied for his first loan from Vision Fund Kenya to enable him buy seedlings and fertilizers to use on his farm.

He hopes to own the biggest farm in Sakutiek area in the near future.

loans.use: To buy seedlings and fertilizer

loans.name: Kaipasi's Group

texts.en:
Kaipasi is a member of this group in Chwele District.  He is pictured here in a group of 7 One Acre Fund group leader farmers.  The group leaders represent a total of 83 individual One Acre Fund farmers who are not pictured here.  Kaipasi has been selected to act as the Kiva group representative and is standing on the right with his hand raised.  He and the other farmers represented in this group are each receiving ¼ acre of maize and ¼ acre of sorghum or millet.  Each farmer is receiving an average input loan of 5,349 shillings for maize, millet and sorghum cultivation.
		
Kaipasi is 42 years old and has been a farmer for 20 years.  Kaipasi works as a farmer to provide for his 4 children.  The community and other farmers know Kaipasi as hardworking and trustworthy.  Other than farming, he is also involved in his community groups such as the prayer group.  Kaipasi described his harvest last year as good, but hopes he can have an even better one with the support of One Acre Fund and the other farmers in his group.
							
Kaipasi joined One Acre Fund in 2010, and is now enrolling in the Long Rains 2014 season as a group leader.  Kaipasi joined One Acre Fund so that he could get the best seed prices, get new farming methods, get fertilizer and hybrid seeds and earn enough to feed family.  Because he is an active community member, Kaipasi has gotten more involved with One Acre Fund as a group leader and Kiva representative.  Working with One Acre Fund has improved Kaipasi's life because he has more profits from harvest, has more farm training and was able to save money.  In the future, Kaipasi hopes that his profits from 2014 can be used to send children to school and invest in a business.  		

One Acre Fund focuses on working with smallholder farmers across Kenya.  The organization pre-purchases seeds and fertilizer when prices are low and passes the cost savings onto the farmers.  Kaipasi and his group will use the Kiva loan to cover this initial cost of purchasing the seeds and fertilizer package from One Acre Fund.  One Acre Fund continues providing training and support throughout the planting and harvesting season to ensure a good harvest and repayment.  With support from One Acre Fund and your loan, these farmers will have a chance at a successful harvest, increased profits and improved lives.							

The field officer is also included in the photo and is standing on the left of the photo.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en: Florence is a 44-year-old married woman. She has 4 children. She describes herself as being determined. She operates a dairy farm where she keeps dairy cows which produce milk for selling. She has been involved in this business for 7 years. Her business is located in a good environment conducive for dairy farming and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate funds. She will use the loan of 50,000 KES to buy stock of animal feed. This will enable her to have enough feed during the dry season for her dairy cows. Her business goal is to reach a wider market within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will improve her living standards. This is her third loan with SMEP DTM. She will use the anticipated profit to educate her children.

loans.use: buy stock of animal feed.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en: Ruth is 33 years old and married. She has 2 children ages 11 and 15 years. She describes herself to be very industrious. She operates a retail shop where she sells beauty products. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her business is located in a place with potential. Her primary customers are ladies. She describes her biggest business challenge to be the high cost of goods. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to add to her stock of beauty products. Her business goal is to own a bigger cosmetic shop within 5 years. She hopes that in the future she will live a better life. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to add to stock of beauty products

loans.name: Lorena

texts.en:
Lorena previously accessed a 19,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for her child’s education and in their personal, household and business expenditures.
 
She would like to apply for another 19,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add in her inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and her child’s educational expense. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Lorena hopes to have other sources of income and dreams to have their own lot. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week, and this is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed for her variety store.

loans.name: Lamzira

texts.en:
Lamzira is 26 years old and a married woman from the village of Dzevri, Terjola district. She lives with her parents, husband and two kindergarten-aged sons. Lamzira's father works at a stone shop and generates 200 GEL monthly. Her husband gets 100 GEL in social assistance from the local government, as they live in poverty. 

Lamzira works hard in agricultural activities. She has two milk cows, sells cheese locally, and also cultivates grapes. Lamzira has great desire to improve the living conditions of her family and increase their income. She lacks access to capital markets and financial institutions to obtain credit for starting up a business, as those institutions require stable income and business experience. 

The Start Up program created by Kiva and Credo enabled Lamzira to get a loan of 1700 GEL and start up a business. She will purchase clothing at wholesale prices and then sell it at a good price among her friends and villagers. The loan will be a huge support for this motivated woman to ensure her family with a better future. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To start up a business selling clothing

loans.name: Khanifaith

texts.en:
Khanifaith is married and manages a retail store selling livestock feed and other supplies in their village to make a living. 

She joined GDMPC and has requested a loan to buy more feed and other supplies to sell. She is hopeful to expand and improve the business to have a better source of income in the future.

loans.use: to buy more livestock feed and other supplies to sell.

loans.name: Remberto

texts.es:
Remberto se dedica al servicio de transporte publico; trabaja desde las 7:00 am. hasta las 20:00 pm. 

El vive en casa de sus suegros ubicado en la Z/Villa Victoria de la ciudad de  La Paz, aproximadamente a diez minutos del centro de la ciudad de La Paz.

El crédito de Remberto es comprar repuestos para su movilidad,continuar atendiendo a sus clientes y asi mejorar sus ingresos y dar mejorar calidad de vida para su familia.

Es la cuarta vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO y la primera vez con KIVA.
texts.en:
Remberto works in public transportation. He works from 7:00 a.m. until  8:00 pm. 

He lives in his parents-in-law's house in Villa Victoria of the city of La Paz, approximately ten minutes from the center of La Paz.

Remberto's loan is to buy replacement parts for his vehicle so he can continue serving customers and thus improve his income and give his family a better quality of life. 

This is the fourth time he has asked for a loan with IMPRO and the first time with KIVA.

loans.use: to buy replacement parts for his passenger transportation vehicle.

loans.name: Dina

texts.en:
Dina, who is married with four children, manages her own computer shop to make a living. She has been offering encoding and Internet browsing in her shop for two years earning well for her family. 

Dina joined GDMPC and has accessed a new loan to buy additional accessories for the shop. She is hopeful to maintain costumer care and to improve her business for a better source of income in the near future.

loans.use: to buy additional accessories for the shop

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick is 42 years old from Naivasha, Kenya. He is married and is blessed with two children, ages 10 and 14 years, who are in school.

Patrick is a hawker and has been in this business for many years. He has applied for his first loan from Vision Fund Kenya to enable him buy basins,mugs,combs etc to add to his stock. He is optimistic that his business will do better after the loan.

He hopes to see his business expand in the near future.

loans.use: To buy basins,mugs,combs etc

loans.name: Victor Manuel

texts.es: El señor Víctor Manuel, es habitante de una comarca cercana al municipio de Juigalpa, siendo  su actividad la pesca, medio con el que mantiene a su familia, tiene tres hijos dos de ellos trabajan con el en la pesca al igual que su esposa quien le ayuda en la casa a vender los pescados y su hija  la menor estudia la escuela primaria, en un colegio público. De esta manera esta familia sobreviven a sus necesidades diarias. Don Víctor solicita el apoyo de crédito para continuar haciendo su labor, pues necesita comprar redes de diferentes tamaños y trasmallos, en vista de que los equipos de tiene en la actualidad ya dieron su vida útil y para garantizar su labor necesita comprar de dichas redes.
texts.en: Víctor Manuel is a resident of a community close to the town of Juigalpa. His activity is fishing and with it he support his family. He has three children and two of them work in fishing, as well as his wife. She helps him by selling fish from the house, and his youngest daughter goes to a public primary school.    In this way, his family covers their daily needs. Víctor is asking for the support of a loan to continue doing his work. He needs to by different sized nets and trammel nets. The equipment he has right now has finished its useful life and to guarantee his work he needs to buy the nets.

loans.use: to buy different sized nets and trammel nets.

loans.name: Edward

texts.en:
Edward is 32 years old.  He is from Naivasha and is married to Agnes. They have two children who are 8 years and 6 years old. 

Edward has a farming business that he has been running for many years now and has applied for his first loan from VisionFund Kenya to enable him buy seedlings and fertilizer to use on his farm.

He hopes to see his farming business expand in the near future.

loans.use: to buy seedlings and fertilizers for his farm.

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
Letecia is thankful for the financial assistance extended to her. She was able to buy more of the farming inputs needed in her business. Her business has been running for six years now as it continues to expand. Her income from the business is helping their everyday household expenditures. She is a widow and she is working hard to provide for her everyday needs.

She would like to apply for another loan of 35,000 PHP. She will be utilizing the loan to buy gardening materials like wire and baskets and supplies such as seeds and fertiliser to be used in her business. Her profits from this business will definitely help her sustain their daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Letecia hopes that her business will last longer and dreams to have a good health. She meets up weekly with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business and draw strength and inspiration from studying the Word of God.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners who gather to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for gardening materials like wire and baskets and supplies such as seeds and fertilizers to be used in her business.

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en: Hannah is a married woman. She has 3 children. She describes herself to be experienced. She operates a retail store where she sells plastic containers, cooking pans, etc. She has been involved in this business for 7 years. Her business is located in an area with potential and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be the lack of capital. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to add to her stock of basins, small water tanks, cooking pans etc. Her business goal is to be sustainable within 5 years. She hopes that in the future she will be successful. She will use the anticipated profits to add more stock.

loans.use: to add to her stock of basins, small water tanks, cooking pans

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is a married woman and has 4 children. She describes herself to be experienced. She operates a farm where she grows wheat and she has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her business is located in a viable place and her primary customers are local consumers. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of funds.

She will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy wheat seeds to grow on her farm. Her business goal is to be sustainable within 5 years. She hopes that, in the future, she will be successful. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM. She will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees.

loans.use: to buy wheat seeds

loans.name: Juanita

texts.en: Being a hard working mother, Juanita supported her husband in cultivating their rice farming business to ensure a high production. She is 38-years-old and has two children. She and her husband want their children to become professional and successful in the future. In this regard, they aim to improve their farming business to be able for them to finance their education. She is asking for a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy fertilizers and herbicides for the maintenance of their rice production. They are hoping that they will have a plentiful harvest in this coming season.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and herbicides for the maintenance of their rice production.

loans.name: Sveta

texts.ru: Свете 56 лет, замужем воспитывает 4 детей. Двое детей женаты, проживают отдельно со своими семьями, дочь-студентка, младший сын проживает с родителями. У Светы- среднее образование, имеет очень хорошие отзывы от своих соседей. Они отзываются о ней как о доброй и трудолюбивой женщине. Света в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи, с 1995 года занимается торговлей фруктов и овощей на местном рынке. В ассортименте: виноград разных видов, яблоки, хурма, гранат, свекла, лук, капуста, помидоры, перец болгарский, зелень, начала этот бизнес с 3,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Светы, она смогла развить и расширить свой товар, ее деятельность приносит около 25,000 сом KGS в месяц, что служит основой для покрытия расходов на питание и бытовые нужды семьи. Также Света с супругом в качестве дополнительного дохода для своей семьи, уже много лет занимаются животноводством, начав этот бизнес с 15,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорному труду Светы, в хозяйстве у нее имеется: 2 дойные коровы, 1 нетель, 2 теленка, 10 овец. Доходы от бизнеса и животноводства позволили Свете расширить свой товарооборот и купить автомашину. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Света обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом - на покупку оптовых товаров в виде овощей и фруктов для дальнейшей перепродажи, хочет увеличить доходы перед Новым Годом, так как будет оживленная торговля перед праздниками. Доходы от кредита Света планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение своего бизнеса, а также в будущем хочет достроить недостроенный жилой дом.
texts.en:
Sveta is 56 years old, married, and is raising 4 children.  Two of her children are married and live with their own families.  Her daughter, who is in school, and her youngest son live at home.  Sveta has a secondary level education and has very good references from her neighbors.  They say that she is a decent, hard working woman.  

Her family's main income is Sveta's business of selling fruit and vegetables at the local market.  She started this business in 1995.  Her inventory includes various types of grapes, apples, date plums, pomegranates, beets, onions, cabbage, tomatoes, Bulgarian peppers, and herbs.  She started her business with 3,000 som (KGS), but as a result of her hard work she has been able to develop and expand her business.  Today, it brings in about 25,000 som (KGS) per month, which is the basis for covering her family's grocery and day-to-day expenses.

For supplemental income, Sveta and her husband are also in the animal husbandry business, which she has been doing for many years.  She started this business with 15,000 som (KGS).  Thanks to her hard work, today she has 2 milk cows, a heifer, 2 calves, and 10 sheep.  The income from her businesses allowed Sveta to expand her inventory and to buy a car.  

With an aim to further developing her business, Sveta applied to the microfinance bank Bai Tushum & Partners for a loan with which she will buy vegetables and fruits at wholesale.  Sveta wants to increase her income leading up to New Year's, since sales go up before the holidays.  Sveta plans to use the income from the loan to invest in growing her business further.  She also wants to finish building her partially completed home.

loans.use: to buy vegetables at wholesale

loans.name: Pastor

texts.en:
Pastor previously accessed a loan of 18,000 PHP that he utilized to buy gardening materials and supplies needed in his business. His earnings were a big help in his personal, household and business expenditures. He has been in this business for 24 years now.

He would like to apply for another 15,000 PHP loan. He will be utilizing the loan to buy gardening materials like wire and baskets and supplies such as seeds and fertiliser to be used in his business. His profits from his business will definitely help sustain his daily needs. He looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in his heart.

Pastor hopes to have varieties of plants to sell and dreams that his business will last longer. He meets up with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his work every week and also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for gardening materials like wire and baskets and supplies such as seeds and fertilizer for his business.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria previously accessed a 50,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help in her personal, household and business expenditures.

Gloria would like to apply for another 50,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her current inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her business profits will definitely help her to sustain her family's daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Gloria hopes that her business will be more flourishing and dreams that her family will always be in good condition. She meets up with her co-fellowship members* every week, to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from studying the Word of God. 

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners who gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages, to resell at her store

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
This is Virginia. She previously accessed an 20,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase a greater quantity and variety of grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed for her business. Her earnings were a big help in her personal house hold and business expenditures.
 
She would like to apply for another 30,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add in her current inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in a better profit. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial loan with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Virginia dreams that her business will last and hopes that her family will always be in good health. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Ma. Victoria

texts.en:
This is Ma. Victoria. She previously accessed an 20,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase a greater quantity and variety of grocery items and products needed for her business. Her earnings were a big help for her child’s education and in there personal, household and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another 25,000 PHP loan for her to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add in her inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in better profits. Her profits from business will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and her child’s education expenses. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Ma. Victoria still dreams that she will have her own grocery store and hopes that her family will have their own house.  She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and also to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Giorgi

texts.en:
Giorgi is a 25-year-old hard-working man, who lives in Batumi city. He has parents and two student sisters. Giorgi's generated salary is the only source for this five-member family. Giorgi gets income from purchasing stock of coffee, grinds it and then supplies stores and shopping malls around the city. He serves clients with a hired car and gets private orders. This business initiative is lucrative for him, but he needs money for further development. Giorgi requested a loan of 3,000 USD for purchasing his own car and to save more income for himself. 

The start-up program, that is joint initiative between Kiva and Credo, enables rural poor people to get a loan for starting or re-starting businesses. His application was approved under the framework of this program to get a loan and purchase a secondhand car. With this financial support, he will expand his distribution and attract more customers. Giorgi will be able to save and provide a better future for his family.

loans.use: To buy a car and supply more stores with coffee

loans.name: Margarit

texts.en: Margarit lives in Dalarik village of Armavir region. She lives with her husband, 13-year-old daughter and grandmother. Together with her husband, Margarit has been involved in agribusiness. Currently they own 22 piglets, 8 pigs and 31 chickens. Near the village where they live, Margarit and her husband own a plot of agricultural land where they cultivate grass which is hardly enough for feeding the livestock. This couple works hard to sustain their family's living and the only source of their income is agriculture. Margarit has already taken a loan from local financial institutions before. But becasue of the family's hard financial condition, she wasn't able to pay it back on time. Due to her and her family's hard work during recent years, Margarit was able to become financially stable ensuring that she will be able to cover monthly payments. Margarit now asks this loan for being able to purchase 2 cows, 2 oxen and forage for feeding the livestock. So, she has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The second-chance loan program provides loans to people who have a bad credit history and have no access to credit products. Margarit and her husband are thankful to all the lenders for helping them to maintain their agribusiness.

loans.use: to pay for 2 cows, 2 oxen and forage for feeding the livestock.

loans.name: Yola

texts.es:
La Sra. Yola es una mujer muy trabajadora vive sola dentro de un colegio  ya que a la vez desempeña funciones de portera de dicho colegio en la zona Las Lomas ubicada en la ciudad de La Paz.  Se dedica principalmente a la venta de calzados para dama y para niños que los compra al por mayor, ella vende todos los dias por la noche a partir de las 8 de la noche en una feria en la zona central de la ciudad de La Paz. La Sra. Yola necesita el credito para hacer la compra de mercaderia (calzados para damas y niños) por la fiestas de fin de año ya que se incrementa la demanda de las ventas y de esta manera poder tener mayores ingresos y asi poder hacer frente a los gastos que tiene en su hogar.

El sueño de la Sra. Yola es poder tener mayores ingresos en base al sacrificio que hace, y poder tener una vejez tranquila, espera  contar con un salario de vejez que le permita vivir mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Yola is a very hardworking woman. She lives by herself in a high school, as she also works as the door woman of this high school in the Las Lomas area located in the city of La Paz. She primarily makes a living by selling shoes for women and children, which she buys wholesale. She sells every night  starting at 8 p.m. in a market in the central area of the city of La Paz. Yola needs the loan to buy merchandise (shoes for women and children) for the holidays at the end of the year, as the demand for sales increases. In this way she will have better earnings and will thus be able to deal with her household expenses.

Yola's dream is to be able to have greater earnings based on the sacrifices she makes, and to be able to enjoy her old age in tranquility. She hopes to have a salary in her old age that will allow her to live and improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a greater quantity of shoes for women and children in order to continue with her shoe sales business

loans.name: Norah

texts.es:
Norah esta casada, vive en casa de un  familiar, con su esposo y su hija menor, en la zona de tembladerani de la ciudad de La Paz.
 
Actualmente se dedica a la venta de pescado de todo tipo en la puerta de su casa, con esta actividad ella ayuda a su esposo y mantienen  a su familia; el credito que solicita es para la compra de mayor cantidad de pescado, pues se acerca la época de fiesta y así continuará con su negocio, ya que es su única fuente de ingresos.

El sueño de Norah es poder comprarse su casita y tener un restaurante mas grande.
 
Es la cuarta vez que solicita crédito en IMPRO y la primera vez en KIVA.
texts.en:
Norah is married. She lives in a relative's house with her husband and her youngest daughter in the Tembladerani area in the city of La Paz.
 
Right now, she works selling fish of all kinds from the door of her house. With this activity, she helps her husband and they support their family. The loan she is asking for is to buy a larger quantity of fish. The holiday season is coming and this way her business will continue, since it is her only source of income.  

Norah's dream is to be bale to buy her little house and have a bigger restaurant.  
 
This is the fourth time she has asked for a loan from IMPRO and the first time from KIVA.

loans.use: to buy a larger quantity of fish to continue with her business selling these products.

loans.name: Wilfredo

texts.es:
Wilfredo esta casado y vive en casa de sus padres en la zona de San Martin de la ciudad de La Paz,  de profesión Chofer.
 
Actualmente trabaja como chofer, pero tambien tiene una fabrica de ladrillos en la zona de alpacoma; el credito que solicita es para la compra de una maquina modeladora, la cual le ayudara tanto a elaborar ladrillos más rápidamente como a mejorar sus ingresos y poder dar a su familia las comodidades necesarias ya que actualmente solo ocupa una habitacion.

 El sueño de Wilfredo es poder tener su propia casa.

Es la tercera vez que solicita crédito en IMPRO y la primera vez en KIVA.
texts.en:
Wilfredo is married and lives in his parents' home in the San Martin area in the city of La Paz.

He currently works as a chofer, but he also has a small brick factory in the Alpacoma area. He is requesting this loan to buy a modeling machine, which will help him make bricks quickly and improve his income so he can provide his family with the comfort they need. Right now, they only have one room.

Wilfredo's dream is to have his own home.

This is his third loan through IMPRO and his first through Kiva.

loans.use: to buy a brick modeling machine for his small factory.

loans.name: Glecy

texts.en:
Glecy is thankful for the financial assistance extended to her. She was able to buy the spare parts and accessories needed in her tricycle business. Her loan is helpful not just in her business, but also in the education of her child. Her income from business assists their everyday household expenditures. She and her husband are helping each other to provide for their everyday needs.
 
She would like to apply for another 15,000 PHP loan for her to buy spare parts and for the maintenance of their tricycle unit. Her profits from her business will definitely sustain their daily needs and her child's education. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Glecy hopes to be more successful in business and dreams that her family will always be in good health. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the word of God that she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for spare parts and maintenance of their tricycle unit.

loans.name: Virginia Del Rocio

texts.es:
EL Grupo De Crédito Calle 1 de Enero se reúne cada 15 días en el Cantón Montecristi,  conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.
En este lugar vive la señora Virginia, tiene 40 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen cinco hijos de 23, 21, 19, 12 y 3 años de edad, los dos menores son los que aun viven en su casa y estudian en colegio y la menor en maternal. Su esposo se dedica a la pesca.
Doña Virginia con la intención de ganar algo por su cuenta y con esto ayudarle a marido se dedica al comercio, vende ropa de todo tipo, su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta también vende en su casa, cuando su marido llega de sus faenas del mar ella se desplaza hasta las playas y les vende a los pescadores,  ella empezó este negocio con el primer crédito que recibió del banco por lo cual está muy agradecida ya que se gana algo por el bienestar de sus hijos.
Este crédito es para comprar ropa. Lleva 3 ciclos  en el Grupo de Crédito y le gusta porque gracias a  los créditos empezó su negocio. Sus sueños son darles lo mejor a sus hijos.
texts.en:
The communal bank “Calle 1 de Enero” [“First of January Street”] meets every 15 days in the Canton of Montecristi, known for its rich pre-colonial culture and for its artisanal products, which are recognized both nationally and internationally. It is also home of the famous Panama or toquilla [a palm-like plant] straw hats. 

Virgina is 40 years old and lives in Montecristi. She is married with five children, ages 23, 21, 19, 12 and 3. The two youngest still live at home and are in school (the youngest is in preschool). Virginia’s husband works as a fisherman. Virginia works selling all kinds of clothing. She started her business because she wanted to earn some money on her own to help her husband. She sells her clothing both door-to-door and from her home. When her husband arrives home from his work at sea, she goes to the beaches and sells to the fisherman. Virginia started this business with the first loan she received from the communal bank, for which she is very grateful because it has allowed her to earn some money for her children.

Virginia is requesting this loan to buy clothing. She is on her third loan cycle with the communal bank, which she likes because she was able to start her business with the loans she received from it. Her dream is to give the best to her children.

loans.use: to buy clothing for resale.

loans.name: Magdalena

texts.es:
La socia Magdalena pertenece al banco comunal LAMAY QOSQO,el banco está ubicado en el distrito de Lamay, provincia de Calca y departamento de Cusco.
La socia Magdalena tiene 38 años de edad,02 hijos y es casada, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de artesania,la socia vende lo que son textiles,polos,entre otros, la socia vende su mercadería a sus clientes que le solicitan, la socia lleva buen tiempo dedicándose a este negocio el cual le va bien gracia al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia a la vez se dedica a la agricultura, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de mercadería como chompas de alpaca.
La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
Magdalena belongs to the LAMAY QOSQO communal bank.  The bank is located in the Lamay district, Calca province, Cusco department.

Magdalena, age 38, is married and has two children.  She alternates her daily activities with the business of selling hand-crafted items.  She sells textiles and polo type shirts, among other things.  She sells her merchandise to her customers who request items from her.  She has been in this business for a good amount of time.  It is going well for her thanks to the great effort that she puts into her business every day.  She also works in agriculture.  She wishes to be able to continue working this way and to continue supporting her family.

She is requesting the loan to buy merchandise like alpaca sweaters.  She is grateful for the loan than was granted, and she pledges to make her payments punctually.

loans.use: to buy merchandise like alpaca sweaters.

loans.name: Josphine

texts.en:
Josphine is a 46-year-old married woman. She has five children. She describes herself to be enterprising. She operates a retail shop where she sells vacuum flasks, cooking pans and other household items. She has been involved in this business for two years. Her business is located in a good place and she has regular customers. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inflation of prices. 

Josephine will use the Kes 20,000 loan to add to her stock of vacuum flasks, cooking pans and other items. Her business goal is to open a general store within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will be able to sustain her family through the business. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to add to her stock of vacuum flasks and cooking pans

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina is a 50-year-old married woman. She has 4 children. She describes herself as a risk taker. 

She operates a restaurant where she cooks food for patrons. She has been involved in this business for 5 years. Her business is located in a place with potential and her primary customers are regular customers. 

She describes her biggest business challenge as being lack of capital. She will use the Kes 10,000 loan to add to her stock of flour, sugar, vegetables and other ingredients for preparing food. Her business goal is to expand within 5 years. She hopes that, in the future, she will be able to create more employment opportunities.

loans.use: to add to her stock of flour, sugar, vegetables and other ingredients for preparing food.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en: Gina is a 33-year-old mother who engages in the buying and selling of spare parts and accessories of motorcycles. She aims to make her business viable to help her husband in satisfying their necessities and save some for the future of their child. Due to insufficient capital, she is asking for a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy more wheels, cable wires and other spare parts and accessories to sell. She is hoping that her loan will be granted to make more improvements in her business.

loans.use: to buy more wheels, cable wires and other spare parts and accessories to sell

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en: Patrick is a 26-year-old single man. He describes himself to be determined. He operates a farm where he grows tea to sell. He has been involved in this business for four years. His business is located in a favorable environment and his primary customers are small scale. He describes his biggest business challenge to be low returns. He will use the Kes 10,000 loan to buy more stock of tea leaves for resale. His business goal is to be successful within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will prosper. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM. He also does dairy farming. He will use the anticipated profits to buy a piece of land.

loans.use: buy more stock of tea leaves

loans.name: Priscilla

texts.en:
Priscilla is a married woman. She has four children. She describes herself as experienced. 

She operates a retail store where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for seven years. Her business is located in a viable location and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge as lack of capital. 

She will use the KES 20,000 loan to add stock of clothes. She hopes that in the future, she will be successful. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to add stock of clothes.

loans.name: Benilda

texts.en:
Benilda previously accessed a 19,000 PHP loan that she used to buy spare parts and accessories and for the maintenance of their tricycle. Her earnings were a big help in their personal, household and business expenditures.
 
She would now like to apply for an 18,000 PHP loan to buy spare parts and for the maintenance of their tricycle. Her profits from her business will definitely help her to cover their daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Benilda hopes that her business will continue to flourish and dreams of having a better living. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her life and business every week and draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for spare parts and maintenance of her tricycle.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en: Gladys is a single woman. She has one child who is 3 years old. She describes herself as confident. She operates a farm where she grows tea to sell. She has been involved in this business for 3 years. Her business is located in a favorable environment and her primary customers are small scale. She describes her biggest business challenge to be pests, which destroy tea. She will use the Kes 10,000 loan to buy more tea leaves for resale. Her business goal is to be successful within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will prosper. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.  She will use the anticipated profits to buy a piece of land.

loans.use: to buy more stock of tea leaves for resale

loans.name: Jane

texts.en: Jane is a 49-year-old married woman. She has nine children with ages ranging from 12 years to 28 years. She describes herself to be determined. She operates a retail store where she sells rice, drinks, bread, biscuits, etc. She has been involved in this business for two years. Her business is located in a conducive environment and her primary customers are small scale.  She describes her biggest business challenge to be low returns.
